result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Stensven was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Maintain employment.  Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  

Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment is granted for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Matthew J Stensven
Current: 312 N 8th St, Black River Falls, WI 54615-1250 United States  (Effective: 02-23-2017)
Prior: PO Box 903, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Sebion.  Parties have the revocation summary.  No corrections or changes noted.  No victim interests, per DA Fox.  Stipulation as to sentence credit as follows:  15CF74, credit for 115.  15CF151 and 15CF165, 72 days credit.  State recommended:  15CF74:  Count 1.  6 months jail.  Concurrent.  15CF74.  Count 2, concurrent 90 days.  Attorney Sebion says this is a joint recommendation.   Court ordered:  15CF74, Count 1:  6 months jail.  Count 2: 90 days jail, concurrent. Credit for 115 days.   15CF151:  6 months jail, concurrent.  Credit for 72 days.  15CF165:  6 months jail, concurrent.  Credit for 72 days.   Judgment for unpaid court ordered financial obligations.
ROAW and summary sent to Judge Becker electronically.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.
wtih attached revocation summary.
from DOC

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew J Stensven
Current: PO Box 903, Black River Falls, WI 54615 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2015)
Prior: 331 N Water Street, Apt 2, Black River Falls, WI 54615
Amendment to Judgment to Conviction - faxed to P & P on 10-6-15 by JM
Waiver of Appearance
DNA Proof of Submission form

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.   Count 1 amended to misd THC.  Granted.  Defendant plead no contest to amended Count 1 and Count 2 as originally charged.  Court advised the charges and possible penalties of the charge he plead to.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated to a factual basis for the plea.  Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court finds that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of amended Count 1 and Count 2 as originally charged.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant did not elect to exercise his right to allocution.  Court ordered sentence withheld, 1 year probation.  Conditions:    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  CC.  maint employment.  not to terminate without agent approval.    Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement and surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 08-24-2015 10:30 am

Pre-trial conference at 07-15-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 08-03-2015 03:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 06-10-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 06-29-2015 03:00 pm.

Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of time limits.  Defendant stated he understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived the time limits for the preliminary hearing.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, and with Attorney Paul Fredrickson for Attorney Poss.  Court advised the charges and possible penalties.  Attorney Fredrickson waived the reading of the complaint.  Waived the time limit for the preliminary hearing and requested that count 2 track with the felony count.  PTC & STC set.

Defendant appeared without counsel.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant states he has received a copy of the complaint.  Court reviews charges and potential penalties.  Defendant will speak to attorney.  Court set an adjourned initial appearance for 5-18-15 at 9:30; also set a $250 cash bond be amended to a $500 signature bond with conditions as requested by DA.
